cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 215 miles southwest of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest parallel to the Baja California peninsula and then curving just offshore of southern California
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central coast of the Baja California peninsula, Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Cabo San Quintin northward to the U.S./Mexico border (west coast Baja California)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm and Hurricane Warnings cover much of the central and southern Baja California peninsula coastlines
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula, Gulf of California, and southern California coastline for swell/rip-current impacts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (2–4" expected, locally up to 6" closer to Mexican border)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to gale force possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – but large swells and dangerous surf/rip currents expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 1–3" to the Los Angeles/Long Beach area late Friday into Saturday, with localized flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells and rough seas creating hazardous harbor entrance conditions and potential berth motion delays
